title: Atropa
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

|   |                                                                          |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | It is tipped with a substance that causes blindness and brief confusion. |

**Atropa** is a [brand](/Brand "Brand") found only on [darts](/Dart "Dart"). When a creature is struck with an atropa-tipped dart, it will be [blinded](/Blind "Blind") and may become [confused](/Confusion "Confusion"); the blindness will last longer than the confusion.

Unlike most brands, atropa's effectiveness is determined by the player's skill in [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") and [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth"), and resisted by the target's [hit dice](/Hit_dice "Hit dice"):

- The chance is `100 - 100 * (HD - 2) / (4 + pow)`, where `pow = (Throwing + Stealth) * 2 / 3`[\[1\]](#cite_note-1).
- For monsters with [HD](/HD "HD") < 15, there is a 3% chance to succeed anyway even if the above chance fails.

## Contents

- [1 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [2 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Strategy

Atropa is probably most effective when used for setting up [stabbing](/Stab "Stab") opportunities, but any fight is made easier if your opponent can't see you or think straight.

Atropa works well enough on early threats like [gnolls](/List_of_gnolls "List of gnolls") or [orc warriors](/Orc_warrior "Orc warrior"), but without investment in Throwing and/or Stealth, these darts will be mostly useless on monsters by the time you reach the [Lair](/Lair "Lair").

## Trivia

[Atropa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atropa) refers to a genus of poisonous plants, the most well-known of which is [Belladonna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atropa_belladonna) (a.k.a. Deadly Nightshade).

## History

- Prior to [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), atropa-tipped darts couldn't blind players.
- Atropa was introduced in [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), replacing the old [confusion](/Confusion_\(brand\) "Confusion (brand)") brand found on [needles](/Needle "Needle").

## References
